communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Related to Maryland Code §11-801, which permits counties to impose fees on "weekend incarcerated individuals"; specifically 

1. The per diem rate, or daily charge, of the weekend incarceration fee imposed in the county detention/correctional facility both currently and in FY23.
2. The daily “average cost of providing food, lodging, and clothing for an incarcerated individual” in the county detention/correctional facility used to calculate the weekend incarceration fee in FY23.
3. The total number of individuals charged the weekend incarceration fee in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23. 
4. The total amount of fees collected from weekend incarcerated individuals in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23.
5. All policies and procedures regarding the imposition and collection of the weekend incarceration fee, including but not limited to guidelines on how these fees are determined and collected in the county detention/correctional facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wayne Byun

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Related to Maryland Code §11-801, which permits counties to impose fees on "weekend incarcerated individuals"; specifically:  

1. The per diem rate, or daily charge, of the weekend incarceration fee imposed in the county detention/correctional facility both currently and in FY23.
2. The daily “average cost of providing food, lodging, and clothing for an incarcerated individual” in the county detention/correctional facility used to calculate the weekend incarceration fee in FY23.
3. The total number of individuals charged the weekend incarceration fee in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23. 
4. The total amount of fees collected from weekend incarcerated individuals in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23.
5. All policies and procedures regarding the imposition and collection of the weekend incarceration fee, including but not limited to guidelines on how these fees are determined and collected in the county detention/correctional facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Dorothy Kilgallen
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

CIA files pertaining to Dorothy Mae Kilgallen (July 3, 1913 – November 8, 1965), who was an American journalist and television game show panelist.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dorothy_Kilgallen

Please search first for any prior releases and/or pre-processed files, and release them on a rolling basis before processing any new material generated by this request.

Kilgallen is listed in the CIA FOIA Case Logs under:
F-2004-00727 Jan 30, 2004 
F-2000-00170 Feb 1, 2000
F-2000-00600 Mar 22, 2000
F-1998-022S1 Nov 12, 1998
F-1998-02519  Dec 28, 1998

However, please do not limit your search of pre-processed files to the above listed cases. More recently, journalist Mark Shaw obtained Kilgallen's CIA and FBI files for the publication of his book "The Reporter Who Knew Too Much" and these files indicated that she was under CIA surveillance. Other requests and cases are also of interest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth J Klein

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Dorothy Kilgallen
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FBI files pertaining to Dorothy Mae Kilgallen (July 3, 1913 – November 8, 1965), who was an American journalist and television game show panelist.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dorothy_Kilgallen

Please search first for any prior releases and/or pre-processed files, and release them on a rolling basis before processing any new material generated by this request. 

Kilgallen is listed in the FBI Federal Bureau of Investigation Records Management Division Records Information/Dissemination Section FOIA Log Report 01/01/2023 to 12/31/2023 under case # 1584873 opened 02-Mar-2023. 

Journalist Mark Shaw obtained Kilgallen's FBI files for the publication of his book "The Reporter Who Knew Too Much" and these files indicated that she was under FBI surveillance.  

If no prior releases are available, please kindly conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, however as noted below, please inform me prior to performing any searches incurring fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth J Klein

title: Central Conference of American Rabbis tax revocation

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Central Conference of American Rabbis tax revocation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

hereby request the following records:
unofficial copies of any documents  filed with the Internal Revenue Service
regarding  05/15/2011 revocation of tax exempt status and documents requesting and granting reinstatement.  Any tax documents filed by them for the years 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 or 2024 and any documents concerning upcoming or pending revocations.


Central Conference of American Rabbis - AKA CCAR
EIN:  13-1769747  New York Charity Registration Number:  05-99-38
Address: 355 Lexington Ave Floor 8, New York, NY 10017

Exemption Type: 501(c)(3)

Exemption Reinstatement Date: 03-15-2012

Revocation Date: 05-15-2011

Revocation Posting Date: 02-22-2012



The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. There is a public interest in the misclassification of this entity as a church, when in fact that is not accurate.

I request that I be properly classified as a news media requester. I am a writer for the Times of Israel and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.
https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/author/julie-guilfoyle/

The Times of Israel is widely recognized for its reporting, publishing regular features on issues of public interest and importance.

In addition, I have covered areas related to this request, and plan to use my editorial skills to analyze and produce original reporting work for my audience.

If you have any questions about my media status, please contact me.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julie Guilfoyle

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julie Guilfoyle

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julie Guilfoyle

communications.subject: Town of Gilbert - Records Request Confirmation- GPDR2024-19852
communications.communication:
* 
  
   
  
 Thank you for submitting a records request to the Town of Gilbert. 
  
 We strive to complete routine requests as promptly as possible, but keep in mind that the Town of Gilbert is closed on Fridays and most government holidays. 
  
 Various factors also affect processing time, including the size and complexity of the request, nature of the records sought, and parameters provided.  The records provided to you will be based off the specific search parameters and keywords defined in your records request.   
  
 You can check the check the status of your request or access your documents by clicking on the reference number link below.  Remember to check your spam filter or junk mail folder for any email correspondence from the Town.  
  
 Reference number is Request Number: GPDR2024-19852. 
  
 Security key is EA2B7759.  
  
   
  
 For questions regarding requests, please email to the below: 
  
  
 Public, Build (Eplan) and GIS = ClerksOffice@gilbertaz.gov.  
  
  
 Police Records = gilbertpdrecords@gilbertaz.gov. 
  
  
 EMS Records (Patient Care Reports and Billing) and Fire Reports (Incident and/or Inspection) = GFRD.records@gilbertaz.gov  
  
  
 You must provide your security key and reference number when inquiring about your records request.   
  
   
  
 Thank you, 
  
 Town Of Gilbert 
 50 East Civic Center Drive | Gilbert, AZ 85296 
 Mon-Thurs, 7:00am - 6:00pm; Closed Fridays

title: 2023 UAV Flight Logs & UAS Deployment Requests

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: 2023 UAV Flight Logs & UAS Deployment Requests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Flight logs for all unmanned aerial vehicles and drones used by your department from January 1, 2023, to December 31, 2023;

- All written requests for UAS deployment from January 1, 2023, to December 31, 2023.

Please regard this link as an example of the format of records I am further requesting. 
https://www.muckrock.com/foi/carson-city-county-8863/carson-city-sheriff-drone-program-140470/#comms

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ariel Van Cleve

title: 2023 UAV Flight Logs & UAS Deployment Requests

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: 2023 UAV Flight Logs & UAS Deployment Requests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- The flight logs from January 1, 2023, through December 31, 2023, for all unmanned aerial vehicles and drones flown by your department.

- All requests for UAS deployments from January 1, 2023, through December 31, 2023.

These types of records were released by your department in March 2023: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/carson-city-county-8863/carson-city-sheriff-drone-program-140470/#comms

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ariel Van Cleve

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Public Body Drone Registrations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) For records of all registration and registration renewals between public bodies and the Department of Aviation.

2)  An electronic (CSV preferred) copy of the data registry for all unmanned aircraft systems registered under subsection (2)(a) of law 837.360. 

3) Records of all annual reports of unmanned aircraft usage between state agencies and the Oregon Department of Aviation under (7)(a) of law 837.360. Please include documents from January 1st 2020 to January 1st 2023. 

Please refer to https://www.oregonlegislature.gov/bills_laws/ors/ors837.html.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alessandro Guzman

title: Policies for Use of Force by Means of a Drone in Texas

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Each policy for use of force by means of a drone submitted to the Texas Commission on Law Enforcement between January 1st, 2022 to October 10, 2024, as described in Article 2.33, Code of Criminal Procedure, in 87 (R) HB 1758

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Blum

title: Facial Recognition Data for Riverside County Sheriff

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Facial Recognition Data for Riverside County Sheriff
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All agency submissions for the CAL-ID facial recognition program from January 1 2023-December 31 2023. Use this document for reference: https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/23167115/agency_counts_log_2022-combined.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

James Moore

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Request System!
communications.communication:
James Moore, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Riverside County Sheriff's Department Records Request System. If you have never used this system, your account has been created by a staff member at the Riverside County Sheriff's Department. 
 
Once your email address has been verified, you can log in to the system to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 
 Login: 174303-56510824@requests.muckrock.com 
 
To verify your email address, the following activation link to set a password will be active for 24 hours. 
 Activate Online Account 
 
If the activation link expires, you will need to request a password by clicking the link below. This will allow you to access your request, manage account information, and retrieve responsive records.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: C001334-101024
communications.communication:
Dear James Moore: 
 
Thank you for submitting a request for public records to Riverside County Sheriff's Department. Your request was received in this office on 10/10/2024 and given the reference number C001334-101024 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: " To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All agency submissions for the CAL-ID facial recognition program from January 1 2023-December 31 2023. Use this document for reference: https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/23167115/agency_counts_log_2022-combined.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

James Moore

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Friverside-county-sheriff-806%252Ffacial-recognition-data-for-riverside-county-sheriff-174303%252F%253Femail%253Driversidesheriff%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAwWr1ZYs61CqFE5DkargQADkI%3A1sz5E7%3AMBtQBnV1agmS7NbQTGWBWUqi5LQwSkK9mvrIhtCo80U" 
Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist.  If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt. (Civ. Code § 10.)  You may be contacted by the department if there are questions regarding your request. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: The California Public Records Act (CPRA) does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Records Request System. 
Riverside County Sheriff's Department
